intro: Acrostichum marginale, commonly known as the golden fern, is a tropical plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the fern family (Polypodiaceae) and is characterized by its distinctive, bright yellow fronds. The plant typically grows in wet, shaded environments such as swamps and marshes. Its fronds are pinnately compound, with narrow, lance-shaped segments. Acrostichum marginale is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can thrive in humid, tropical climates.
